author: .vbuterin
content: > It seemed like a nice mechanic, allowing higher nonce messages cover too low FeeCap of earlier ones.

author: .vbuterin
content: I think the idea there was just to simplify the EIP by making sure there's no negative numbers in the spec

author: .vbuterin
content: I suppose we could remove the restriction.... though if we want to *actually* support child-pays-for-parent that would be a larger ask for the ethereum network as a whole

author: .vbuterin
content: Because I don't think it supports that now

author: .vbuterin
content:
> Hi. I'm Kubuxu, one of the devs of Filecoin. As you probably heard we've implemented our version of EIP1559 in Filecoin.
<@!96996691282001920> Any learnings from the implementation so far?

author: kubuxu
content:
One you caught right after we've implemented and before we were able to communicate it to you all, it is that minimum basefee needs to be greater than 0 (or 1, we've set it to 100).
Other than that it works quite well. Our capacity is variable due to tipset system which requires some changes and adds noise.
